cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles north of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north then north-northeast, forecast to parallel Florida’s west coast and curve toward Apalachee Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: Englewood northward to Suwannee River on the Florida west coast (includes Tampa Bay/Manatee area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Dry Tortugas only (well south-west of the port)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from the Florida Keys northward through Tampa Bay to Apalachee Bay
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes – surge of 3–5 ft possible along Tampa Bay/adjacent coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible Thursday afternoon through early Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels 3–5 ft possible in and around Tampa Bay including Manatee County shoreline
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches widespread with isolated 4 inch pockets, producing localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents likely along the west-central Florida coast
